The Department of Radiology | Radiology                                      Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Radiology                                                                                  Home   About Us   Patient Care   For Healthcare Professionals   Research   Education                                  Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                           The Department of Radiology                                                      For over one hundred years, The Department of Radiology at NYU Langone Medical Center has advanced the practice of radiology to serve the healthcare needs of patients and physicians. Today, we offer comprehensive and state-of-the-art imaging examinations and image-guided procedures to support NYU Langone Medical Center, a world-class patient-centered integrated academic medical center that is one of the nation’s premier centers for excellence in healthcare, biomedical research and medical education.                                                                         Research                        Our mission in the Department of Radiology at NYU Langone Medical Center is to transform the field of Radiology to improve the lives of people.       More               Education                            The NYU Langone Department of Radiology takes great pride in training and educating radiologists of all ages and experiences. Our main education goal is to help shape the future leaders of radiology.       More               For Healthcare Professionals                        The NYU Langone Department of Radiology continues to improve its services and imaging in order to better serve of referring physicians and patients. Facilities: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Photography & Imaging About the Program Curriculum & Course Offerings In-House Resources Department Grants & Fellowships Gallery News & Events Alumni Directory of Faculty &amp; Administration Student Work ISOZine Facebook Twitter Instagram Blog  home > Photography & Imaging > Facilities          The Photography & Imaging Labs are for the exclusive use of Photography & Imaging majors and students currently taking classes in the Department of Photography & Imaging. These students are charged a lab fee each semester, or for non-majors, each studio class they are registered. The Labs are comprised of 2 black and white gang darkrooms, 2 digital labs with a total of 30 work stations which feature a number of scanners and printers as well as professional imaging software, and 2 shooting studios. There is also an equipment cage which houses a variety of cameras in formats from 35mm to 8x10 to DSLR and Leaf digital medium format, digital audio and video recorders, plus a substantial range of lighting equipment for use in the studio or on location.  Digilab Equipment & Software Complete list of software packages and equipment offered in our Digital Imaging Labs. Please note that this is updated on an ongoing basis as things change rapidly. Please contact the Digital Coordinator should you have further detailed questions. More Digilab Etiquette & Rules Rules all users must abide by in the Digilab, regardless of whether you bother to read them. Only students with a functional handscan are allowed in the lab. No exceptions. More Digilab Help, Incident Report & PDF Guides Download Ways to find help and help yourself in the digilab.   Department guides for software and processes have been created for in-house use and should be use for reference only. More Lab Hours Hours for the department wet labs and the digilabs. More Specs for Homepage Images & Student Work Galleries Get noticed. Have one of your images included on the Tisch Photography & Imaging website homepage.  Have an edited multiple image series? Send us a compressed folder, or drop off a disc of images for creation of a student work gallery.
